author: {'steamid': '76561197977567326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1411936135}
review:
Okay, this is nothing short of amazing.  It's a Williams game - Defender, Tempest, Robotron 2084.  It's pure evil, and it wants to hurt you.  Probably laugh while it's doing it, too.

Gorgeous graphics, an excellent selection of very different gameplay modes (an unexpected and very welcome touch!).  This has one-more-go hard-wired into its DNA.  It's brutally addictive.

The graphics, though lush and lovely, never get in the way of what's going on.  The colours do trick you sometimes.  You think you're heading for a green bomb pad, but no, it's a virus cluster of nearly the same shade.

Slo-mo helps, but is in short supply.  The bomb mechanic takes some getting used to and doesn't always work.  One time, the voice started saying 'Bomb ready', but the combo had dropped (and with it, the bomb) before she'd even said the two words.

I paid 79p for this game.  Honestly, if that decimal place had been moved two places to the right, I still would have thought I got a brilliant bargain.

Can't recommend it highly enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050906786', 'num_games_owned': 283, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1561995606}
review: По-моему отличная время-убивалка, сам наиграл в оффлайне много. Прекрасный представитель своего жанра, очень динамичная, красивая,с большим количеством режимов, но, конечно же, не очень разнообразная, большую роль здесь играет переигрывание на хайскор, так что любителям жанра точно понравится, тем, кто же, кто не любит выбивать хайскоры советую пройти мимо.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029377844', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 898, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1615208375}
review:
挺不错的。由于并非游动式而是滚球式，移动有惯性需要稍微适应一下。

WASD移动，鼠标左键射击，右键是Slow Motion。然后连出Combo后可以用空格放Bomb，Bomb的感觉很舒服。

然后有各种模式可以让你玩。原价稍微贵了点不过现在0.99美元还算划算。可以一玩。

author: {'steamid': '76561198090080625', 'num_games_owned': 485, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1412495760}
review:
中规中矩的射击游戏，场景比较小，就像在培养皿里互相争斗的细菌，
有很多不同模式但其实就是在原有基础上加了一些限制，比如只能躲避，定点射击等等。
背景音乐很有太空感，配合画面，多边形的场景就像太空医生阻止病菌的培养和繁殖。
画面色彩很绚烂，但是射击比较单一，就是hit and run 贴着圆形场景的边多方风筝即可，
比较有特色的是鼠标右键的放慢时间，很好用，对于响起警报敌人的围堵可以很好的躲开。
没有武器升级没有不同的射击角色选择，大概比较适合喜欢刷高分的人....

review: An excellent game in the vein of Robotron and Geometry Wars. The gameplay is great and slowly ramps up to give you a chance to learn how to best approach each of the enemy types you face. It has a great feel with points, powerups, and bombs. Check it out if you have any interest in the aforementioned games, because this is well worth the price (at $0.99 at time of writing).

review:
シンプルな全方位シューティングゲームですが、こういうタイプのゲームはＸＢＯＸコントローラーで遊ぶのが適しています。

以前はキーボードでやっていました。何か今一つってかんじだったんですが、最近それを購入しました。
移動しながら打ちたい方向にショットするのにこのコントローラーが直感的に操作できるのがおおげさながら感動。
もともとキーコンフィグでそのコントローラー設定の項目があるのでそれ推奨なんでしょうか。
今ならＸＢＯＸコントローラーは安く買えるはずなので（自分もアマゾンで2600円程度で購入）

author: {'steamid': '76561197998296277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1411065997}
review:
This game rips off quite a lot  from Geometry Wars, but I wouldn't say that's inherently a bad thing. Geometry Wars is a damn good game, and honestly I think Waves is a far better game.

A lot of that sentiment comes from how Waves differs from Geometry Wars in terms of its more nuanced mechanics. While both are minimalist twin-stick shooters with similar art directions (though not identical, since Waves uses 3D models), Waves and Geometry Wars have fairly different ways in which they handle their score multipliers and bombs. Waves also has a bullet-time mechanic that's based on a meter you fill as you destroy enemies, and enemies you kill while slowed down net you a point bonus. You can also get point bonuses from destroying enemies at point blank, in which you have a circle around your ship that shows you the radius enemy ships have to be within in order to get the point blank bonus. Overall I just prefer the mechanics in Waves over Geometry Wars.

I haven't played Geometry Wars: Retro Evolved 2, but from what I've read about it Waves it at least on par as they both offer a good handful of game modes that the original game does not have. Some modes in Waves are pretty much identical to ones in Retro Evolved 2 (Waves' "Crunch Time" and RE2's "Deadline" operate on the same principle of scoring as high as you can on a time limit), others are mostly similar with a few added wrinkles that slightly change how it plays ("Bombing Run" in Waves plays much like RE2's "Pacifism", but with the added quirk of having to deliver a bomb to a specific point on the map before the bomb detontates on yourself, losing a life in the process). Meanwhile the "Chase" and "Rush" modes in Waves not like any modes in Retro Evolved 2 (funnily enough, the only mode in RE2 that Waves doesn't have an equivalent for is, in fact, called "Waves").

Sadly, Retro Evolved 2 isn't available on PC. I don't feel too terribly sad about that, however, as Waves is a fantastic alternative. I can totally respect a developer who decides that they want to make a game that's *ahem* "heavily inspired" by an existing title, but then they aspire to make it just as good or possibly even better than the game they're ripping off. 

Also, the soundtrack has a track in it that samples Kefka's iconic laugh from Final Fantasy VI. I just can't argue against something like that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116582587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1498238598}
review:
I found this game in the suggest games that Steam put there for me. The name was what caught my attention. And I have to say that Steam did a REALLY good job by saying I might like this game, considering the ones that I already own. I absolutely love Waves. I bought it like an hour ago and already have over 3 million points! :D I'm thinking that's pretty good, but it might be terrible, I'm not sure.

I would not recommend this game to people who like a slow, thought out kind of gameplay. This is a fast paced type of game where you need really good reflexes and awareness. Your eyes have to be constantly searching and your fingers always moving. A lot of things are going on at once, like dozens of explosions, things flying everywhere, bright lights. Its pretty extreme!

There are multiple modes to play in (Survival being my personal favorite) and each is unique. The settings are great, you can change the keybindings to your liking and change to mouse sensitivity. The graphics are great and amazingly smooth. The aim seems perfect to me and I always like going into slomo to see my enemies explode. I find it a very pleasurable game and hate to exit it off. Just the fact that I have a high score makes me want to keep playing. And of course you HAVE to beat your friends' score, right?

author: {'steamid': '76561197985512939', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1407907853}
review:
Holy heck this game is bad.  For starters, the graphics are too noisy.  After a minute or two of playing you can't tell enemies from powerups and not only does this cause deaths and frustration, but it's so blatantly trying to rip off of Geometry Wars that it's not even trying to hide how poorly it was handled.

The game is uninteresting, mechanics are beyond boring, and the scoring system is fundamentally flawed such that it favors luck over skill in almost every scenario.

Finally, the music and robotic voice are interesting at first but like the rest of the game, become annoying after the first few games.

Save yourself the time and frustration and play something else.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993363806', 'num_games_owned': 1054, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1428386638}
review: The heir to the Geometry Wars throne. Basically perfect. A combo mechanic ensures that the game is always scaling to just beyond your comfort zone. The better you do, the harder the game gets and the more points you score. A fine example of really polished arcade game design.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136576294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1619955336}
review:
This game is similar to most other twin stickers, yet waves makes it look really good while doing it.  It's visually very pleasing, and Waves also has a pretty decent soundtrack.  Waves isn't reinventing the wheel, but it does over some original game types, 6 or 7 in total.   

Ive purchased it at $1.99, and have seen it at the price several times, it's every bit of worth that price.  It's usually $5, I believe.  After playing it, I would have spent the $5.

Rating based on Gameplay and Replayability. 8.2/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198063835826', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 580, 'last_played': 1416797406}
review: Basically Geometry wars retro evolved meets an elite upgrade. This is the most addictive game I have played in a while. The score board keeps you coming back for more. Chill playing this or take it seriously. Either way. Completely worth the price. 100% Legit. Though you might not enjoy it unless you have a controller. It's not really meant to be played with a Keyboard/mouse. You 'can' play with such but.... I strongly recommend a controller.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984320376', 'num_games_owned': 768, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 796, 'last_played': 1450305639}
review: Waves comes through 100% for a game in the Twin-Stick Shooter genere. Music is great, visuals are great, and the various game modes and degree of challenge is on par for what you'd expect from these types of games. This one goes right up there with the classics like Geometry Wars and its sequel. Worth the buy, especially if its one sale! 5/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198025343532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1498992538}
review:
Waves is an awesome fast paced 'arcade' style shooter that for the price is an absolute steal! This game is incredibly addictive, has great graphics and colours, a great selection of different modes from survival to bomb run and also has an amazing retro themed electronic soundtrack to go with it.

Add this all together and you get a great addictive game that you will play for a long time to come, as these types of games don't really get old.. ever! 

Would highly recommend and for the price it is 100% worth it! I would give it 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143223512', 'num_games_owned': 286, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 3799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1537095603}
review:
Simples mas não simplório, frenético e colorido, waves é um bastante arcade perfeito pra vc que curtiu asteroides, mas com muito mais luz, mais cores e uma trilha sonora super bem encaixada. Apesar de poder ser jogado com teclado e mouse,
waves é um jogo que proporciona uma experiencia mais legal com o joypad.

Com o bastao esquerdo vc movimenta a bola no ring, com o bastão direito vc atira e direciona os disparos podendo atirar em uma determinada direção e mover-se livremente ao mesmo tempo. Com um gatilho do lado direito vc usa o buffer que é um slow motion curto que recarrega com alguns segundos. Com o gatilho esquerdo vc dispara as bombas que só podem ser usadas quando vc acumula um combo de 10 hits e ficam disponíveis por algo como 3 segundos.

Isso torna o jogo bastante difícil e variado na medida em que vc sobe em niveis.

Waves conta com 7 modos de jogo e uma tabela de scores pra cada modo.  Durante toda partida vc ve do lado direito o primeiro colocado do score para o modo q vc joga no momento. E cada modo é bastante particular

o primeiro é o time crush, durante 3 minutos, com  vidas infinitas, vc deve acumular o maximo de
pontos que puder

o segundo é o survival no qual não ha contagem de tempo e vc possui 3 vidas, podendo ganhar vidas extras ao longo da
partida

o terceiro é rush onde voce começa a partida com um minto e meio de tempo e vidas ilimitadas, mas vc perde 10 segundos
a cada vez q perde a bola. podendo ganhar 10 segundos toda vez q subir de nível.

quarto: Bombing run,  você perde o poder de atirar podendo  continuar usando o slow motion e uma função para dar um knock back objetos ao redor. o jogador deve se manter em constante movimento tocando nos icones vermelhos, q são as bombas para eliminar os objetos da tela.

quinto: é o chalenge, você conta com três vidas para passar por uma série de desafios especificos

sexto: chase, você pode atirar mas deve manter a bola em constante movimento passando pelos
icones vermlehos tendo 4 segundos para tocar o proximos icone vermelhos

o ultimo é o Hold, um novo elemento aparece, um circulo de luz que se move pela arena aleatoriamente
o jogador pode rolar para fora do circulo mas só pode atirar desde que esteja dentro do circulo 

o estilo de Waves convinda você para um desafio colorido e dançante. garantindo diversão para uma ou mais pessoas

experimente Waves, 2011, da Squid In a Box
baixando gratuitamente o demo na steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015399925', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 505, 'last_played': 1577238681}
review: [b]Waves[/b] plays like an arcade game with the intensity of an FPS. There's nothing more satisfying than narrowly avoiding that one enemy or when you first break a score of 10 million. The different game modes keep it uniquely challenging and fresh for a really long time. My personal favorite modes are Survival and Bombing Run, which both keep your heart pounding until that heartbreaking moment when you inevitably explode. The soundtrack is amazing and brings an additional layer of awesomeness to an already great game. 10/10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198083995757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1406312409}
review:
Ein wirkliches gutes Gelegenheitsspiel zu kleinem Preis.

Berherzigt alles was ein gutes Spiel benötigt. Simpes Spielprinzip, einfacher Einstieg, nicht unfair ansteigender Schwierigkeitsgrad, unterschiedliche Gegnertypen (Bewegungsmuster) und es motiviert allein durch das Gameplay. Dazu noch verschiedene Spielmodi mit sehr guten Ideen zur Abwechslung.

Allerdings wirklich nur ein Gelegenheitsspiel das man zwischendurch für 30 Minuten oder eine Stunde spielt.

Kleiner Tipp: Sobald sich sehr viele Gegner auf dem Monitor bewegen unbedingt die Slow Motion Funktion benutzen.^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198015835461', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1645360680}
review: very funny

author: {'steamid': '76561198045198405', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1491149534}
review:
Premières impression :
Waves est un jeu très distrayant ! Simple de part son gameplay, mais diversifié par ses 6 modes de jeu. C'est un petit jeu qui passe facilement le temps !
Le principe : Tuer un maximum d'ennemis tout en esquivant ceux-ci. La petite boule jouable fait penser à la forme boule de Samus (Metroid).

Très plaisant !

review: If you like twin stick shooters this game is a must buy. It's my favorite TSS (I use KB & Mouse) that I've played. I enjoyed it more than the PS3's Super Stardust. It's very addicting! Get it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198039868153', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1440898984}
review: This is a very cute game and a good way to spend a few hours. It's got a fantastic soundtrack and is very fun to play for a while. I got tired of it before too long but it's certainly worth a few dollars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034172959', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 466, 'last_played': 1517107859}
review: Waves is a highly entertaining top-down twin-stick shooter. With its retro aesthetic and its frenetic pace combined with a tight gameplay, Waves provides a great arena shooter experience. There is a decent number of modes with interesting rules, and also a good electronic musical score.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125538770', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1405857912}

author: {'steamid': '76561198065656866', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1556975730}
review: highly reommend grait fun

author: {'steamid': '76561198091811243', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1031, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1650880145}
review: The graphics and sound are great in that they aren't overly much to distract you but at the same time gives that little extra to the game to make it more... physically attractive. The actual gameplay is fun and adicting, easily able to be picked up at random if you're bored (or whish to procrastinate)  and you won't get "burned out" and bored from playing it a lot either. Imagine Geometry Wars, but more spherical, hexagonal, 3-D, and musical, it also feels more modern/up-to-date than GW. Fun arcade game, worth the small bit of money, and the music is really nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960478145', 'num_games_owned': 2349, 'num_reviews': 616, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1542808760}
review: Nice brainless twinstick shooter with extremely flashy visuals. I had no idea I was into chiptunes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025091679', 'num_games_owned': 2328, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1507996525}
review:
This is one of the better games on Steam, it's so very simple yet addictive and good-looking that you just can't stop mashing the buttons. Such colors, very eye candy, wow. Unlike many 2,5 dimensional shooters which are repetitive and uninteresting, Waves is totally awesome like a zombie ninja Jesus riding a motorcycle into outer space.

Playing Waves is very easy, but getting good at it is next to impossible. Needs good eye-hand coordination and swift reflexes. The game gets FAST in a minute or two, and that's an old school definition of FAST, where 0,05 second gap really matters and a slightest error kills you instantly. TO DEATH. Like, really.

Just go ahead and buy it right now. This game is good, and you should feel good about it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996899722', 'num_games_owned': 1437, 'num_reviews': 266, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1404428636}
review:
I don't think I have the reaction times to play this properly. :).  I really enjoy playing Waves.  It's visually stunning, and the music is fantastic.     The choices of games to play is pretty good, and the game rewards the tactical player who looks ahead to see what the next step will be, thereby chaining their moves for bigger and bigger multipliers.  

Watching a ripple of destruction echo outwards from the epicenter of your bomb, or taking out a cloud of incoming bogeys with a well-placed storm of bullets is great.     The game can be frustrating at times.  It's a dual-stick game, so it's very easy to momentarily fumble a direction of movement with a direction of firing.   

The only downside is that the last time I tried to play it, it crashed on Windows.  No other games crash. Some update must have broken it.  I've reinstalled, to no avail, so it's getting uninstalled :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198059666767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1145, 'last_played': 1635012117}
review: At first I was addicted to this game due to its similarities to Geometry Wars, but I really like this game more as the waves become much more intense, the games modes are more diverse and interesting to play, and the kill-threshold bomb is really awesome when you get it going. The one dispute I have about this game, is the way they implemented one achievement. The idea in a game like this one is to get your score as high as possible right? Wrong. In this game the score maxes out at 2.1 billion and you get an achievement but THE COUNTER STOPS GOING. That is a horrible, game-breaking thing to do to an old-school styled arcade shooter. YOU PUT A FUCKING CAP ON THE SCORE YOU RUINED THE GAME FOR ME.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071445821', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1567963219}
review: This is one of the nicer dual-stick arcade shooters I've played. It has a relaxed vibe despite all the chaos on-screen, and the many different modes ensure that you'll find at least one way to play that suits you. The concept and execution are great; it's only a shame that due to engine licensing, this game didn't see a release on GNU/Linux. I recommend this game to anyone who enjoyed Beat Hazard or Geometry Wars.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979186288', 'num_games_owned': 93, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1415514468}
review: I had some problems with actually running the game at first. It would crash as the game attempted to boot up everytime BUT, the forums had the problem solved already and I just needed to download an updated Physx driver of some sort. This game is addicting, colorful, twitchy, but also relaxing. I could easily vibe out to this game for extended durations. It kind of reminds me of Geometry Wars on steroids. More variety and challenges to pick from along with exceptional twin stick arcade fun. A must play!

author: {'steamid': '76561198028049202', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1403650884}
review:
I recommend this to anyone who enjoyed Geometry Wars. The gameplay and graphics are very similar.

The scoring and combo system took me a while to get used to, but once I did, it was pretty fun. 
Perhaps some more effective tutorials would help ease players into the mechanics.

My only real complaint is that gameplay sessions lasted a bit too long. Geometry Wars was fun because the sessions were short, and you always wanted to play "one more time!". Here you get a bit too many lives.

But still, a fun experience overall.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983747223', 'num_games_owned': 1361, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 7138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2929, 'last_played': 1426904475}
review:
It is a bit difficult to find truly great twin stick arcade shooters on PC. There are quite a few of them around, but my search has been to find something as close to the PSN great Super Stardust HD as possible. A truly amazing twin stick shooter that many of us even got for free after the infamous ApocalyPS3 where PSN got hacked a few years back. Our reward was free games for not being able to login for a month! I ended up with Super Stardust HD, Little Big Planet, and inFamous as mine so I did well, but Super Stardust HD was the big surprise of the lot and I have been searching for a similar twin stick shooter ever since. 

Waves may not be the same as Super Stardust HD, but I am very happy with the similarities and this style of twin stick shooter regardless. So my search for similar games to SSHD actually DOES result in finding some other greats now and then. In SSHD you played on a sphere where you orbited planets and destroyed asteroids and enemies with bombs and a boost. This spherical type of Twin Stick I have yet to find another one worthy of mention unfortuantely. In Waves you are inside a flattened circle,  but it does give me the close-quaters bombs and instead of a boost it gives us a "Slo-mo" feature to get out of sticky spots. 

Waves is easily one of, if not the best twin stick shooter on Steam imo. It has a similar graphical style of Geometry Wars where everythng is minimal, but that is perfectly fine and works well. It serves up massive combos like most shooters should have and has a great deal of different game types you can play. In fact I was very impressed by the amount of different game types avaialbe in Waves, and these have been doled out for free over the course of its life. 

The main game type, however is Survival, and it means what survival means. Stay alive as long as you can and try to get the highest score possible. Unfortunately, the game has a max score limit of just over 2.1 Billion. It's not particularly easy to get here, but it is there. There are only a couple hundred Waves experts who sit a top the leaderboards with this max score so you aren't going to get to it without A LOT of practice and time played. I am not one of these experts who has achieved the score...yet. 

Other game types include Bombing Run, which you play with just bombs. Hold, which was just released in March, is a mode where you can only use your weapons when you are inside a designated area of the screen. So no flying all over the place to avoid things, you must get into the attack zone to keep yourself alive. Crunch time gives you quick events that you must beat from other game modes. This is just a few of the game modes and there are 6-7 total if I remember correctly. All with their own Steam Leaderboards for the community, friends, and Local. The Leaderboards actually work too unlike many of the other shooters on Steam right now. (ie. Scoregasm, although Scoregasm is a pretty fun TS shooter for a cheap price)

Waves is definitely a GREAT twin stick shooter for any fan of the genre and I would highly recommend it. If you are one that wants to get massive scores and are willing to put in the practice and play time you can get there. With all the game modes available, and the time it may take to reach a score you can be proud of, you will be able to play for dozens of hours, if not 100+ hours. Waves is now a staple of my Steam gaming library for when I just want to jump in a game and start shooting things!

Steam Achievements are plentiful and are broken down to each different game mode so you can only get them all by trying all the modes. They aren't particularly imposible to get, although your skill level must increase greatly as well as your undestanding of the mechnics to achieve most of them. 

Gamepad support is fine (BTW...TWIN STICK Shooter means they are meant to be played with...TWIN STICKS, not a keyboard and mouse...lol) with the XBox 360 gamepad, although I use a PS3 Dualshock 3 Gamepad with the DS3 Tool. For me, I wanted to flip the buttons around for bombs and slow-mo so using the DS3 tool made that very easy to do without having to go into an .ini file to change it up. There aren't control bindings in the game options so you need to do it manually, or with something like the DS3 tool. DS3 Tool is faster and easier for me as it is just changing the buttons up in the 360 emulation config rather than having to update the .ini file anytime there is a patch, which could replace that .ini file. 

Waves 2 is now in the works as well and looks to be taking community suggestions of adding many different weapon types and other game styles. From videos I have scene it looks like it has some sort of "maze" style to some of the modes where you maneuver around walls and fight enemies this way. Oh yeah...Waves 2 also has a co-op feature it appears. It had a kickstarter a while back, but didn't get funded unfortuantely, but it's still being develped, however and you can find a lot of gampelay videos of it on Youtube. I am lookign forward to that as well. It looks different enough that Waves 2 won't actually "replace" Waves as a game I will play. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197986597237', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1565201965}
review:
Waves is similar to Geometry Wars in the sense that it's a strictly one-arena twinstick shooter. There are no "natural obstacles" in the arena, just enemies to shoot.

One notable difference is that the sphere the player controls in Waves has momentum, so it won't switch movement directions on a dime. There's also several different game modes.

The enemy cavalcade isn't all that impressive, though, based on what I've seen so far.

The game has plenty of challenge, mind you, for a semi-casual twinstick shooter fan like me, and it also has online scoreboards.

Waves is one of the better twinstick shooters I've played. It's too bad its follow-up failed at Kickstarter.

review: Generic, typical, almost Tetris-like playbility. Waves is a large amount of fun! The awesome, upbeat music makes it for a great atmosphere along with the cool background. This game reminds me of Tetri a lot. You play it, it's straight-forward and simple, you play a lot of it, get bored and play other games, yet come back just to play it again. And with the different modes, there's lots of challenges to keep you interested. I'd recommend this basic game as something you can just chill and play any time you feel like. 8/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972269714', 'num_games_owned': 431, 'num_reviews': 172, 'playtime_forever': 681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 674, 'last_played': 1404132239}
review:
I've had Waves sitting in my library for some time now, but have only recently gotten around to giving it a solid go. Waves offers up a fairly simple arcade arena shooter. You might associate "simple" with some sort of negative - not at all. The mechanics on offer here all gel well together to create something that you can pick up for a short playthrough and have a great time.

It would be amazing to see a multiplayer (co-op) mode and see how far you and a friend could get. Given the various game modes on offer, I can imagine some interesting co-op mechanics to keep the pace going.

As it stands, this is a fun little shooter that is perfect to pick up when you have a few minutes of down time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003114902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1559278596}
review:
Absolutely fantastic. This is one of the few games I always keep installed in my library. It's also my favorite game to hand off to my "console gamer" friends when they come check out my PC. Looks awesome, runs smooth, it's a blast to play when blazed... there's really no downside.

How could it be improved? Co-op game modes with support for multiple controllers on the same PC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123763020', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1427603674}
review: Waves is a fantastic game that of which offers many game modes and gives you hours of enjoyment; in pieces. Waves is really one of those games where you just have the slightest bit of time on your hands, and your bored at the same time. Waves can give this, but if you are a gamer that plans on playing a game for hours at a time, this might not be for you. But if you want a cheap, fun game, that of which offers great short term enjoyment, I cannot recommend this game enough. Overall, I give Waves a 7.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016056323', 'num_games_owned': 775, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1457244923}
review:
Este juego, es una copia bastante lograda de un juego que se llama Geometry Wars, que salió para Xbox, y luego hubo un port para PC.
Muy logrado, la musica acompaña, los graficos ayudados por el motor Unreal (que no tenía idea de que se podía usar para cosas como esto) no decepcionan para nada, muy muy lindos graficos. Aunque a veces la pantalla se llena demasiado de efectos, y eso afecta a la jugabilidad. Aunque considero que es una decisión de diseño, no deja de molestarme... a mi, por lo menos.

El juego destaca y se diferencia con varios modos de juegos que están muy buenos. Y aunque se nota la carencia de Pop-ups (como los que había en Geometry Wars), y el sistema de bombas es medio extraño, no deja de estar bueno.

Vale totalmente su precio, la musica es muy buena. Y... no es caro para nada, así que si no les gusta... tampoco es que gastaron U$D60 en el juego...

author: {'steamid': '76561198005230618', 'num_games_owned': 1813, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 1719, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1664, 'last_played': 1396787384}
review:

ボムによるコンボが爽快。
経験値やレベルアップ回収のために動き回る必要もあって
常にどう動き、どう稼ぐかを追求し続けるゲーム。
後半は敵も増えて更にボムが気持ち良くなる。

author: {'steamid': '76561197988328815', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1395964896}
review: I really nice shoot'em up. Fun, simple, very beautiful and a blast to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126731581', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 443, 'last_played': 1594412371}
review:
Pues bien, inspirado en GeometryWars, supongo, este es un alucinante y psicodélico juego. Mucha acción, gran colorido, sensación de poder, así como una música llena de energía lo definen. 
He pasado algunas horas jugándolo, muy recomendable si no tienes tiempo para embrollarte en tramas complicadas y pasar horas pegado a la pantalla. Este es un juego muy entretenido y puede jugarse de a ratos, el nivel de dificultad varía mucho según el nivel, además los logros Steam le añaden un reto extra. 
Cómprate algunas copias para regalar a los amigos y pasen horas derrotando scores. Muy recomendable.
Los textos que aparecen al final, tras perder una partida, o batir un récord son un excelente gesto de los desarrolladores, a quienes les gusta humillar a los perdedores y enaltecer a los héroes de la destrucción.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040843971', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1410504153}
review:
Waves, where being a ball that spits out bullets becomes fun. 

I think it's a shame waves always takes place in the same map, I wish there were more of them. I don't think it would too much effort. The graphics are avarage for an arcade game, (naturally) there is no story, the controls are very userfriendly and the gameplay is fast and satisfying. I love the local highscore feature. It's too bad waves only has like what, three soundtracks?

I personally like this game a lot, it's great to kill some time with (for example when you're facing a long loading screen), has user friendly gameplay and is fun to play with friends. I'll rate this game a 7 out of 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097550961', 'num_games_owned': 221, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 713, 'last_played': 1653833697}
review:
Well, its not often you stumble across games such as this, a gem of an indie which is both gorgeous to look at and ridiculously addictive. The basic concept is a two stick arcade / high score / challenge type affair, guiding your ball across the 'waves' and defeating various enemies to achieve combo's and bombs. The urge to keep beating that high score keeps the replayability of this game right up there, aside from your usual 'survival' mode there are other game modes such as challenges, bomb runs etc.

All in all, well worth the money and will be one of those games you return to time and time again...worthy of note is the chiptune soundtrack which accompanies this game is pretty sweet as well!

author: {'steamid': '76561198073469724', 'num_games_owned': 411, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1467876193}
review:
操作は直感的に理解できるくらい簡単でかつ凝ってる割に手頃な値段。
細部グラフィックが凝ってたりslomoを使うと音楽がゆっくりになったりしてなかなか良い。
音楽が個人的におすすめ。

ゲーム自体はシンプルなもので自機に敵機が当たらないようにしつつ撃ってスコアを稼ぐゲーム。
英語表記ではあるが全く見なくても問題はない。

まずはデモ版をやってみるといいかと。

author: {'steamid': '76561198006590007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1624731663}
review:
If youve ever wanted to blast geometric figures with a sphere that shoots plasma balls, this is the game for you.

You control a sphere that you roll around inside a cylinder from a top down view, making it a 2d circle. With your sphere you shoot plasma balls/beams that destroy other geometric shapes when you hit them. Those shapes spawn in intervals, depending on the level youve gotten to. You gain levels by destroying the shapes and collecting little blue orbs of EXP that conveniently home into you when you get close enough.

This is a greatly fun game in short bursts. Its simple to learn, but difficult to master.

It is also clear that this game is a fantastic way to increase your hand-eye coordination, multi-tasking potential, and accuracy of short-term logical predictions. As you gain levels it becomes exponetially more difficult to coordinate your spheres movement (cannot touch any other shapes or youll explode!), your plasma beams, and the path youll need take your sphere in the next 1 - 3 seconds to avoid the semi-predictable paths of the other shapes and avoid touching any of them, lest you explode.

Graphics: For what the game is, Im satisfied with, and enjoy, the graphics. They are colorful, appealing to the eye, and mesh together well. 10/10

Sound: I have no complaints about the sound other than that there are not enough music tracks. I believe there are 4 total, which are nice tracks, but a little on the low side quantity wise, which can start to become repetative. 8/10

Gameplay: Intense, is the best way to put it. Perhaps even "overwhelming" at first once you get 8 or 10 levels into say "Crunch" mode (3 minute game, get highest score possible). But thats not a bad thing; as stated above, Waves really has awesome potential at training your hand-eye coordination, multi-tasking, and movement prediction capabilities. 10/10

I got this on a whim while it was on sale, and I am very satisfied that I did. I would fully recommend this game to anyone who enjoys intense, even overwhelming levels of information that need to be dealt with immediately lest you explode. I also see this game as having the potential for being a training game for just about any other fast-paced video game out there.

Final score: 28/30 = 9.33

PS: Ive seen reviews questioning if this game is OK to be played with mouse and keyboard instead of gamepad. I play with M/K, and I find no intrinsic problems using them as opposed to a gamepad. Ive used both on Waves, and prefer M/K myself, but it all comes down to personal preference. Im very adept at M/K, but not so great with gamepads that require stick usage. 

Id recommend trying both, and seeing which feels better to you right off the bat. Whichever does will probably be your best option.

review: I love twin stick shooters i've played them all this one is fantastic great graphics and numerous play modes elevate this one to the top of my list,i picked this up in the sale last week for under 1 euro after it was on my wishlist for about a year i should of got it earlier i know.I recommend this to all the arcade junkies out there who love building up highscores.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970683857', 'num_games_owned': 873, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1512942703}
review: Whoa! It's what the next Geometry Wars should have been.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975525432', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 864, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1572635510}
review:
Waves - Gelegenheitsspiel mit Sucht Faktor

Was gibt es hier großartig zu sagen als einfach nur "Genial" ein so simples Spiel mit so vielen Spiel Modis...


Survival - Der Typische Spielmodi mach soviel Punkte wie möglich ohne Zeit druck mit 3 Leben

Rush - Unendlich viel Leben - 2 Minuten Zeit soviel Punkte wie möglich zu machen - Pro Level up und Cube bekommst du Zeit oben drauf.. Stirbst du werden 10 Sekunden abgezogen

Hold - Du kannst nur in einem angezeigten bereich schießen. Dieses Feld bewegt sich. 3 Leben verfügbar

Bomb - Trage die Bombe von der Roten Fläche zur Grünen innerhalb von 10 Sekunden - Du kannst nicht schießen alle Kugeln/Punkte werden nur mit den Bomben gemacht

Challange - Eins der interessantesten. 20 Level die man mit Bravur "1-5 Sterne" meistern muss. - Umso höre Combo/Schnelligkeit desto mehr Sterne/Punkte bekommst du

Crunch Time - Mach soviel Punkte wir möglich in 3 Minuten - Unendlich viel Leben - kein Time Bonus

Chase - Eines der schwierigsten. Du musst innerhalb von 5 Sekunden von einer Roten Plattform zur nächsten und während dessen soviel Punkte wie möglich erschießen. 3 Leben verfügbar, unendlich viel Zeit.



Absolut Genial.. Das Spiel läuft mit Unreal Engine und hat etwas von Super Hexagon und wer das mochte wird hier voll auf seine Kosten kommen auch die Musik erinnert sehr daran.


Im Angebot kein fehl Kauf sogar für den Normalen Preis ist es akzeptabel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081898900', 'num_games_owned': 149, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1572909096}

review: Very beutiful and relaxing game, for me at least. Reminds me alot of Super Stardust and Geomtry Wars. I love these kind of games and I can play them for years as a stress reliever. The worls needs simple games like this for when you're just tired of everything else. Oh and the soundtrack, bravo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029903975', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 25288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14056, 'last_played': 1516841638}
review: This game is like adding nitrous oxide to a high powered classic from the eighties. It is rush hour at the busiest intersection in Mumbai during a lentil sale. And shockingly, this game is sold in finished form for a pittance but inspite of that they just added "Hold" gameplay which has actually improved the game in ways that I couldn't even imagine. If Skyrim is a ten out of ten, then you'd have to give Waves an honest 16.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039501194', 'num_games_owned': 510, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 8573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7580, 'last_played': 1528172454}
review:
EDIT:  After having broken the game's score counter in Survival mode (it only goes up to 2.4 billion points) I can safely say this game is worth the money.  Get it on sale if you can, but even at full price, it's never boring.

This game gets flak for being a bit simple and for being too hard; at the same time, no less!

It is what it is; it is a top-down shooter.   You're a ball, a trippy ball.  You shoot other things...there're lots of them, they never end.

The music is excellent, the graphics are quite polished and surreal, the game itself hums to the beat of the music; the controls are fantastic with a gamepad's analog joysticks, and there is absolutely no reason a fan of shmups (shoot 'em ups) should not love this thriller.

My favorite feature of the game so far is that in the Survival mode, the AI will form nets around you in an attempt to ambush you.  They spawn in a circle and close on you.   One slows down time, punches a hole in the net, and gets out of dodge.

...or one dies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032382434', 'num_games_owned': 2467, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1486045774}
review:
So... 
Amazing soundtrack: Check
Fun Gameplay: Check
Easy to learn and play: Check
Increasing difficulty: Check

Everything a fun game needs.
This is a fun little twin stick shooter, when I say twin stick I mean it can be played with keyboard and mouse as well as controller. Twin stick is a game design, not literal. Basically you're using one hand to move and the other to aim and shoot.

Set up your combos and try getting the highest score you can master.
There's a variety of gamemodes to choose from too.
Also, enjoy the soundtrack, it's fantastic.

It's a fun little game, if you enjoy twin stick shooters with music that you'll be humming for weeks and be literally dying to put on your computer/mp3player/ipod etc. Then you'll definitely want this game.
I recommend it completely!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046859514', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1389231651}
review:
A fantastic Astroids-esque game. If you've ever played Geometry Wars then this is very similar - in fact, a lot of the game modes are almost identical (with slight twists like bomb pads instead of gates like in Geometry Wars) . That being said, if you're looking for a game to compete against yourself and friends this is it. I've found myself saying "just one more game" over and over with this one. 

My favorite thing about this game is that the duration of play time is totally up to you. If you only have 5 minutes to play, you will still easily be able to play a full round. Likewise... If you have 5 hours to kill, prepare to get mad at yourself and have a blast doing it.

Pros: Great visuals and music, addicting gameplay
Cons: Limited selection of game types, leaderboards are implemented poorly and are slow to browse

7/10

This game is different in that, there is a "leveling" system that tells you how difficult the game will be as you progress, the game has a great soundtrack and interesting enemy types, I just wish there was more variety in the game types, and weapons for the ship.

review:
This game is a shoot-em-up for those who don't care for auto-scrolling. You have full control of your character, a rolling ball, and disaster or salvation is completely in your control... At least, as much as it can be with enemies coming in from all sides. Colors are bright and vivid, and this game's demo is worth trying out to at least get a feel for how your computer will run it. Other than achievements and scoreboards, though, there's not much to keep people hanging in. No story to speak of - just stay alive. I didn't feel that detracted from my enjoyment at all.

Frenetic, flashy, and fun. A nice diversion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053514042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1651458132}
review:
This game has a pretty cool soundtrack.  And the difficulty level is pretty high for some of the game modes.  There are several game modes you can try, all of them are fun.  Most importantly, this is the type of game that is equally satisfying whether you want to play for half an hour, or three hours.  After that, you'll probably want to go find something else to do... but you'll be back for more later.

You control a little ball that has guns in some of the game modes and bombs in others.  You roll around on a little arena that reminds me of something like Beyblade.  It's sort of round and takes up the entire screen, but you can't leave it or move to another arena.  Enemies will come at you, each type of enemy moves and attacks differently.  Sort of like the old Defender space-shooter game.  Kill enemies quickly to earn chain bonuses (more XP per kill) and use bombs to kill several at once for more bonus XP.  You can also use your special power to slow down time like in The Matrix, allowing you to evade enemy fire or kill several of them in quick succession.  Kills in slow-time earn you more bonus XP.  As you level up the enemies get more determined to kill you, you gain access to bombs, you get time bonuses to keep the action going, etc.  Most game modes have a timer that you can recharge by killing enemies or getting special timer items.  When time runs out (or when you run out of lives) it is game over.

review: Anyone who is a fan of oldskool arcade arena shoot em ups, stuff like geometry wars.. This is really amazing. Very easy to jump in and out of quickly. I found the games in geometry wars took much longer to get exciting, waves gets into the crazyness quite fast and keeps you there as long as you can stay alive. It looks great, the soundtrack is great and the feel is very responsive. High scores can be destroyed if you manage to pull off amazing stunts. Don't get me wrong, Geometry Wars was and is a true classic, not saying Waves is necessarily better.. I just find this more modernised and it requires less commitment to get that burst of fun in :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197998785170', 'num_games_owned': 1759, 'num_reviews': 247, 'playtime_forever': 830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1398330465}
review:
I guess for a shooter that isn't beatable, it doesn't make sense to wait until I beat it to review it, and I've played it for several hours already. This is just super great. In some ways it's just a very well done twin-stick shooter, which makes for a good game but doesn't really stand out by itself. It's polished, and all the fundamental mechanics feel and look and sound good. The things that really keep me coming back for a couple rounds every few days are the extra mechanics on top of the basic ones and the well thought out game modes (one in particular).

A slow motion ability is not exactly a new or unique concept, but it's used well in this game, with a limited meter for it that drains VERY quickly and recharges moderately quickly, so it's very often available, but only in small amounts. You also get bonus points while using it, so you have to decide whether to trade off using it to save your life or be risky and use it to pad combos for more points. The other main mechanic is the bomb system. Your combo multiplier goes up as you kill more enemies without a break of more than I think three seconds in between, and at certain multiples you're awarded a bomb, which as in most games insta-kills anything in a relatively large radius around you. However, unlike most games, you cannot save it for later use. You have a few seconds to activate it, or it's gone forever. If timed/chained properly though, you can use a bomb to get you a good chunk of the way to your next bomb, then repeat. Of course, when there are enough things on the screen that you can get away with that, you need to be on your toes or you won't last long.

It has some common game modes like unlimited time with a limited number of lives, or infinite lives but a fixed amount of playtime, and some more exotic or panic-inducing ones like the one which lights up a small spot on the screen, and if you don't move to it within a few seconds you die. Once you get there, it picks a new random location. Oh, and you also have to keep playing the normal game while doing that. Good luck. The one I've really gotten stuck on is Bombing Run, which takes away your guns entirely but continues to spawn enemies. It places a bomb pad at a random location where you can pick up a bomb, at which point it creates a delivery point at a different random location. When you bring the bomb there, it detonates like a bomb in the other normal modes, and a new bomb pad is generated. If you get a high enough combo, you can get a single-use defensive shield, but mostly it's about positioning, movement, and reading patterns and paths through what becomes a huge, chaotic mess at higher levels. It's really great for practicing that stuff without being distracted by all the shooting you're normally doing in most modes of most games, and it's just plain fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980203845', 'num_games_owned': 307, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3988, 'last_played': 1677362936}
review: This game is at least a 9/10. If you have ever enjoyed a twinstick, buy it. Rest assured, this is such a well designed game, slick movement, beautiful graphics that don't impede your ability to read the arena and a really aggression oriented scoring system. There's no messing about, just bomb everything. It's not when to use the bomb, its maneuvering into the perfect position before it times out, hitting slomo and detonating it. Getting into the lizard brain zen state in Waves is awesome, I haven't played them all but this has to be the best twin stick you can get, if someone has a better one PM me now.

WA-VES !

review:
[i]I beat a high score and the game's narrator said "whatever." 11/10[/i]

A really tight twin stick shooter. The graphics, music, interface are marvelous. The menus are peppered with snarky remarks.

The gameplay itself is highly enjoyable and offers several modes that suit differen't people's tastes.

Highly recommended for fans of twin stick shooters.

PS. Bombing Run mode. Bombing Run mode. Bombing Run mode. Bombing Run mode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065678891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 521, 'last_played': 1498389774}
review:
Back in the days when I just purchased this game, I wrote the following in my recommendation:

"Waves is rather funny, in fact. It's a good casual game to kill some minutes of your day, if you like shooting, running away from multiple enemies and dropping megabombs to make a rainbow of sparky explosions. It reminds me of old 2D games representing some spaceships rushing through hordes of aliens or asteroids with their Big, Terrible Guns. Also, after each game you will receive some witty remark from the devs; their sense of humour is... remarkable."

There's not been really much to add since; I'd just say that buying the game gives you rather little advantages. The other music tracks that are not available in the demo are actually quite dull; as for the other game modes, they do add some difference and new experience to the gameplay, but generally the demo version of Waves fulfills its time-killer functions exactly as nicely as the paid one.

review: Типичное инди.Оригинальная и незамысловатая идея-просто управляй шариком и бей других шариков ;D Интерес представляет из себя саундтрек-без него сырой геймплей,а с ним-веселье да и только.Некоторые утверждают,что он даже "подстраивается" под вашу игру.Увы,такого феномена мной замечено не было-иногда даже в разгар "рубилова" просто включилось спокойное интро.Единственный глобальный минус-неоптимизированность.Пришлось снизить в настройках производительности все "плюшки";и это при том,что их и так там не много.7,5\10

author: {'steamid': '76561197977016810', 'num_games_owned': 1469, 'num_reviews': 190, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1415858027}
review: Waves is an amazing game, easy and relaxing, but also difficult and rage-inducing. Still worth buying even if it has the basic mechanics of a dual-stick run-and-gun arcade shooter. author: {'steamid': '76561198024246936', 'num_games_owned': 4981, 'num_reviews': 194, 'playtime_forever': 10607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10364, 'last_played': 1499624688}
review: Probably my new favorite arena shooter. Not a complicated experience, but an enjoyable game to pick up and play, whether you've only got a few minutes to spare, or a few hours. It's a lot like Geometry Wars with more than one mode of play, and with the mechanics tweaked a bit so that the game gets more exciting and rewarding the longer you play and the better you become. The demo is highly representative of the overall experience, so do yourself a favor and check it out. I managed to snag this for $2.50 during a Daily Deal, but if you're into these sorts of games, the asking price of $9.99 isn't shabby considering the insane amount of fun I have with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979445690', 'num_games_owned': 9989, 'num_reviews': 223, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1550299544}
review: Superlative arena based twin stick shooter ala Geometry Wars but uniquely utilizing a combo based use em or lose bomb acquisition system.  Employs slow motion techniques for extended scoring but usage or buffer depletion lessens recoverability in tight situations so as the great Johnny Cash would say (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1-OrzG3id_8).  Allows for zen like mastery where you perpetuate in a zone and keep extending time (Rush mode).  Multiple game modes.  Supports the Xbox 360 controller.  Without being overly dramatic, where did this come from? It's awesome.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964009814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 339, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1346482800}
review:
Pretty cool, small little game.  The basic idea is that you are ball that rolls around shooting other objects to get score.  Had several game modes and all of them were decent.

Very colorful and easy to control, and if you get a combo of 10 hits quicky - you get a bomb to use to lose.... but I did wish that there was "random" powerups - the bomb is the only power up.  

You do level up, but I never noticed what leveling up does.  Good little game, I played a little under an hour and got 16 achievements.  If you love bullet hell style games, you might like this since the twist isn't bullets but instead so many enemies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045870755', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1415723205}

author: {'steamid': '76561197986219590', 'num_games_owned': 2278, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1416883368}
review: The best twinstick shooter since Geometry Wars 2. The different modes all play very unlike each other, and the combination of the combo system, timed bombs, and bullet time add a lot of depth and nuance to the basic shooting action.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963000314', 'num_games_owned': 1421, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1346396400}
review: Geometry style gameplay. Yada Yada

author: {'steamid': '76561198038749202', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 494, 'last_played': 1377163292}
review: Waves (commonly misread as: Woves) is a twin-stick shooter for people who respect games with names like Geometry Wars. Comparisons to Bizarre's legendary shooter notwithstanding, Waves is about as good as it gets for twin-stickery on the PC and if you have a thing for aggressive geometry, leaderboards and some ridiculous menu tips then Waves may just be your thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047268090', 'num_games_owned': 2327, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1370, 'last_played': 1635429225}
review: 非常にバランスの良いシューティング。自分はボール状の何か。ステージも円形の何か。敵も玉とヘックスのコンピュータウィルス的な何か。ひたすら全方位へ撃つ。連鎖すればボムれる。特徴的なのは速度ダウンのトリガ。時間の進みが遅くなる様子は自分の脳が高速化したような感覚。サイバーな高速感と高揚感。カジュアルゲーでシューティングでメタスコア82。もっと買いが入ってもいいと思われるゲーム。オススメ。Xboxコントローラーはあったほうが遊びやすいと思います。

author: {'steamid': '76561197976825693', 'num_games_owned': 1829, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 3, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3, 'last_played': 1342335600}
review:
Waves is a great example of what's possible with UDK from an indie perspective.
It enjoys beautiful visuals and fast paced action.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052274989', 'num_games_owned': 270, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1031, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1003, 'last_played': 1681246557}

author: {'steamid': '76561198023042534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1392061222}
review: This game is truly something magical. It has all the qualities of a 'geometry' shooter along with a beautifull ambient styled soundtrack that will mezmerize you everytime you click the Start Game button. If you've always enjoyed playing ambient shooters, definetly consider buying this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984645657', 'num_games_owned': 626, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1362297600}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198037099260', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1155, 'last_played': 1570056596}

review: Waves is visually beatiful and naturally immerses you into it's intensive play. It is simple to learn, and difficult to master. A great game that you can always come back to for a few minutes, or a few hours. Waves is a twin stick shooter that is difficult to pass up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987913961', 'num_games_owned': 1621, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1393094691}
review: So once upon a time there was this guy who made one of the best games of its genre and then he couldn't afford any advertising so nobody bought it and so he was sad and didn't really make a lot of money even though he should have.  If you've purchased either Geometry Wars game then you really owe it to this guy to buy his game since he did a way better job than was done on Geometry Wars.  It would be like buying Singularity but never buying Halo or Gears or CoD.  It's just silly really.  So don't be silly, just buy Waves.  If you haven't purchased either Geometry Wars games then that's really good because now you don't have to because now you can just buy Waves instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993996349', 'num_games_owned': 1105, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1594241646}
review:
A fun small twinstick shooter.
Simple yet intuitive mechanics, unique graphics and a good soundtrack. Perfect for some minutes gaming or to relax, though there are still multiple gamemodi so it doesn't get boring aso fast (especially because of the achievements).
The enemies are very fun, some spread like viruses and some dogde your shots, it is enjoyable that the longer you play the harder and interesting the enemies become.

Only downpoints is no story, no multiplayer and maybe that sometimes it feels a tiny bit random, but that's a problem of all twinstick shooters I think :P

author: {'steamid': '76561197969796810', 'num_games_owned': 803, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1511666717}
review:
Waves is a game very much in the same mold as Geometry Wars: you control a little abstract gun platform and you move and shoot in twin stick fashion with the left stick moving and right stick aiming and shooting.  Like most games of this ilk the fun is in the relentless and frenetic action of the unceasing hordes that home in on you and the satisfaction comes from the "dodging raindrops" finesse you acquire when "in the zone".  There's even a charging bullet time effect to help you out in a pinch. 

As a bonus there's some extra game modes available, but the primary action is the best.  There's a trippy electronica soundtrack and a lot of glitzy effects to go with the excellent color palette choices.

My only beef is that there's not an escalating sense of your own lethality which means the climb in intensity levels off and you just continue fending off the frenzy, which while fun can lead to weariness if you're able to pull off a long survival streak.  Other than that it's a delight!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025030213', 'num_games_owned': 2990, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1367564400}
review:
Waves is a fixed map style shooter that is the most fun game in the genre that I've played since 1987's Crystal Quest.

Waves describes itself as "accessible" and that label is absolutely spot on. Waves never aggravates with its gameplay and never frustrates with any part of its implementation. It is beautiful, runs at high resolutions, and was clearly built for play on a computer.

Waves boasts a Matrix / Max Payne bullet time buffer that can be tapped to get the player out of a bind. Bombs and clustering virus cells round out the experience.

Waves' multiple game modes all feel like peers rather than second class additions to a primary mode, and each are fun and varied.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027388002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1350630000}
review: This shoot 'em up game offers a few different modes to keep you entertained and techno music  to keep your mood u. Can I just say I LOVE the smell of exploding geometry?

author: {'steamid': '76561197972342048', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1163, 'last_played': 1450577086}
review: Waves is basically the best twin-stick shooter in existence. It is so good that I love it even though I don’t as a rule like twin-stick shooter. Addictive as hell, with multiple fun modes, and ridiculously polished; its only downside is that I now dream of geometric shapes and my thumbs hurt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060955844', 'num_games_owned': 744, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1068, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 894, 'last_played': 1544290224}
review: Zaskakująco "prosta, ale skomplikowana" gra, która miażdży genialną muzyką, klimatyczną grafiką (mix psychodeliki i Trona) i uzależniającą pogonią za biciem własnych rekordów. Dave approves! ;]

author: {'steamid': '76561197971872425', 'num_games_owned': 1722, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1358582400}
review:
A lightshow of a twinstick shooter, set within a round arena, The game typically plays like Geometry Wars, but takes the best from all the Geometry Wars clones over the years and even the bomb chainreaction gameplay from Every Extend and multipliers when you destroy multiple enemies with one shot. There's also a slow mo feature which you have to keep full to use, again, by destroying more enemies in sucession.

  The game has it's own flashy 3D style, a very short soundtrack and multiple game modes. There isn't any real incentive to play this game but beating scores and no real level progression, just one arena until you lose all lives/time, unless you play the other modes.

A pretty damn good twinstick shooter. Squid in a box is one to look out for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034445356', 'num_games_owned': 2712, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1609861718}
review:
De la musique 10 bits entrainante, de bons graphismes, de l'action intense, un scoreboard mondial.

Voilà ce que nous propose Waves, un jeu plus que sympa lorsque l'on a 20 minutes de temps libre :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198041939717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 889, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 726, 'last_played': 1527377762}
review: Amazingly it captures your attention and forces you to delve into the game as you use your eyes and responsiveness to rank higher and higher. The music even makes it a little easier to feel like you dwell in the game. One can easily put hundreds of hours into this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023565947', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1334041200}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198006574782', 'num_games_owned': 2443, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1345964400}
review: Waves is an arcade action game that is slightly less twitchy than Beat Hazard and Scoregasm.  The game features a variety of modes that help keep the action refreshing and the addtion of controller support and widescreen modes are welcome.  The graphics are not amazing, but the use of a ball instead of a space ship adds a physics element to the challenge missing in other similar titles.  The music is average, not particularly bad nor memorable but taken altogether Waves is an above average entry into the field.  I recommend this game to anyone who likes either action or strategy, and particularly players that prefer gamepad controller play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979796744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1342854000}

author: {'steamid': '76561198016518213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1447056811}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970320868', 'num_games_owned': 3641, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1427082282}
review:
This is by the Arcadia guy, but where that was a buggy unplayable SDL based mess, this is a fun and polished Unreal engine based twin stick shooter in the Geometry Wars style.

It includes pseudo Bullet Time (you slow down too, but it gives you time to think). Smart bombs are infinite but limited in time, so use one almost as soon as you get one. Do enough damage and you can chain them! Rush mode is my favorite.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964018315', 'num_games_owned': 701, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1710217560}
review: Yes it may be very much like Geometry Wars but it certainly has refined it to a absurd degree  in terms of gameplay and design, making it my go-to game for twin-stick shooter fun. The differnt game modes coupled with the numerous enemy types makes me always want to give it one-more-try. Definitely give this a try if you like shooters, puzzle, or twitch like gaming.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040776450', 'num_games_owned': 3889, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1565375748}
review:
Energetic and colorful topdown shooter with different game modes, good if a bit repetitive soundtrack and achievements! I would play the hell outta this game if I could play it on my phone.

Яркий и красивый шутер с видом сверху. Тут есть несколько крутых режимов игры, няшный, но короткий саундтрек и аж пятьдесят ачивментов! Если бы такая игра шла у меня на телефоне, я бы никогда больше не заскучала в автобусе.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989897720', 'num_games_owned': 780, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 901, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 867, 'last_played': 1677088725}
review:
My hands hurt as I dodge right and swing down the screen, my gun swinging in the opposite direction as I take out the swarm of yellow at close range. In the clear but if I'm going to keep my multiplier I can't dawdle. I veer off towards a growing cluster of explosive death, hitting slow motion to dart between two oncoming enemies. Bomb ready, but if I just hold off for a few moments longer... oh crap.
 
At the heart of Waves is managing the risk-reward ratio. You can take the game at your own pace, but only by pushing yourself to your limits will you achieve your best scores. In doing so it manages to avoid the frustrating ‘brick-wall’ that can hamper many other dual-stick shooters. Dying is more often a result of you misjudging your own skill, than it is the game throwing more at you than you can handle, and very rarely a result of anything ‘unfair.’ While as the genre-name suggests Waves works much better with a gamepad, I’ve found it is easily playable with a keyboard and mouse, albeit at the expense of finer movement control.
 
The game provides six different game modes, which serve to shift the balance of different elements of the gameplay. Survival, Rush and Crunch Time alter the balance between the need for speed, power and survivability; Bombing Run and Chase require you to move quickly from one target on the arena to another, favouring those with manoeuvrability and path-finding skills. Finally challenge mode is all about accuracy, and conserving your shots for maximal efficiency.
 
Waves is the first dual stick shooter that has really managed to capture my attention, managing to deliver on ‘easy to learn, hard to master,’ without sticking a vertical cliff in the difficulty curve.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042259317', 'num_games_owned': 4297, 'num_reviews': 414, 'playtime_forever': 657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1650863493}
review:
RIP Rob/SquidInABox 2022

Waves is a bright and hectic twin stick shooter with many similarities to Super Stardust HD and Everyday Shooter (except with smoother controls) It is crafted to the point of a perfect arcade style game, where a player's failure or success is purely based on his or her skill and not cheap deaths. Easy to play for casual gamers, challenging enough for hardcore gamers. Multiple game modes to whet your appetite, though I prefer Bombing Run (no gun, one shield and bomb per red pad collected in 10 second time) and Chase (get to the red pad before time is out). Rush and Survival are also extremely fun. 

The soundtrack, composed by Smiletron (who has made alot of great electronic music) is an absolute wonder to hear, as it causes a near trance-like state when playing the game at high volumes with a good sound system - I was deeply immersed in this computer word when this chiptuney music was playing over the rave club-like techno bass. Having a subwoofer/surround system or really good headphones makes a huge difference.

Waves is my favorite multidirectional shmup of all time and I intend to keep it permanently installed to go back to on occasion. Get this game, so Squid in a Box can fund their next project.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021350309', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 8723, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2805, 'last_played': 1666848846}
review: Easily one of the best twin stick shooters ever made, leaps and bounds ahead of most of the ones you'll find on Steam or elsewhere. The only one better than this IMO is Nex Machina, and I honestly think if you want to tackle Nex Machina you need to be able to max out the high score on Waves first. If you can max the high score on this game you are at an elite tier of gamers. Waves should be a "Pro" game and be played competitively just like LoL and CS.

review:
Wow.  This was the very first game I ever reviewed on Steam.  It's the game that started my love of indie games. This game holds a very special place in my heart, now more than ever.


RIP Rob thank you for hours upon hours of entertainment.  Thank you to Rob's partner for making both games free (Waves 2 is free on Steam now as well) so that people can experience these simple yet amazing games for years to come.



Fantastic indie game. It's asteroids for the modern day, with a few hits of acid mixed in.  One fo the most innovative indie game I have played in a long time.
